actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

official_title: A bill to assure timely, rational, and complete Federal Communications Commission resolution of all pending proceedings reexamining the current radio and television broadcast stations ownership rules.

summary.text: Broadcast Ownership Reform Act of 1999 - Directs the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to modify its rules for multiple ownership of television (TV) broadcast stations to increase to 50 (currently 35) percent the national audience reach limitations for TV stations owned by the same entity or person. States that the FCC's newspaper-broadcast cross-ownership rule shall cease to be in effect after December 31, 1999, unless it is reinstated by the FCC before January 1, 2000.

titles.title: A bill to assure timely, rational, and complete Federal Communications Commission resolution of all pending proceedings reexamining the current radio and television broadcast stations ownership rules.
